result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Lee Schmidt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brandon Lee Schmidt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brandon Lee Schmidt was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/cost to be paid to the Clerk of Courts Office. 60 days to pay or set up payment plan. Failure to do so will be warrant.
Participate in and successfully complete any assessments and follow treatment recommendations referred to by Community Supervision.
Must provide DNA sample and pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge if applicable.

**$500.00 Restitution, plus 10% surcharge of $50.00, for a total of $550.00, to be paid to the Department of Corrections**  
Restitution can be paid out of prison wages.  Any bond posted to be applied to Restitution.
Must pay supervision fees and Court ordered financial obligations.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.
